de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader

Interface ReaderListener<T extends BaseTag>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of tags the listener can handle
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener

    public interface ReaderListener<T extends BaseTag>
extends java.util.EventListener
    Listener interface implementation for Reader events.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void newTagDetected(java.lang.String uid)
      Invoked when a new, previously unknown, tag was detected by the reader.
      void newTagProcessed(T tag)
      Invoked when a new tag was successfully read and all tag related data is available.
      void readerError(ReaderException e)
      Invoked when an error occurred while interacting with the reader.
      void tagDetected(java.lang.String uid)
      Invoked when a tag was detected by the reader.
      void tagError(TagException e)
      Invoked when an error occurred while interacting with a tag.

    • Method Detail

      • tagDetected

        void tagDetected(java.lang.String uid)
        Invoked when a tag was detected by the reader.
        Parameters:
        uid - the UID of the detected tag

      • newTagDetected

        void newTagDetected(java.lang.String uid)
        Invoked when a new, previously unknown, tag was detected by the reader.
        Parameters:
        uid - the UID of the detected tag

      • newTagProcessed

        void newTagProcessed(T tag)
        Invoked when a new tag was successfully read and all tag related data is available.
        Parameters:
        tag - the tag that was processed by the reader

      • tagError

        void tagError(TagException e)
        Invoked when an error occurred while interacting with a tag.
        Parameters:
        e - the tag exception that caused the error

      • readerError

        void readerError(ReaderException e)
        Invoked when an error occurred while interacting with the reader.
        Parameters:
        e - the reader exception that caused the error
